Tankor: You see that coffin-like bed over there? That's a renewal 
chamber. Get in and tell me when you're ready. You'll start feeling 
numb and then you'll fall asleep as soon as I push the trigger.

OOC: He can even come out reformatted... hint hint!

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> ooC: Hmmm I have an idea. I'm thinking that the renewal chamber can 
> mess him up so much that he'll come out completely different, and 
> he'll think he's a memeber of the Tripreds. =0
> 
> -- Firedrill --
> 
> Firedrill nods at each member present, looks down at himself, then 
> blinks. "Yah, I guess I do need to use the renewal chamber." He then 
> walks off to the renewal chamber.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Belthassan shakes Firedrill's hand: This is Tankor. He, Thrust, 
> Strika 
> > and Jetstorm, who are absent now, are new Tripredacus.
> > 
> > Tankor: Whoa you look battered... Better go to Renew Chamber... 
> I'll 
> > show you the way.
> > 
> > He starts to go to the east side of the base.
> > 
> > OOC: You can always blow him up in the chamber, since it's made 
> for 
> > techno-organics... or just lock him in there for some times...
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> > > -- Firedrill --
> > > 
> > > Firedrill nods to Belthassan, and offers his hand, "Thank you. 
> You 
> > > must be, Belthassan correct? Quite a nice collection of energon 
> > > fruit, umm, who's that other bot?" Firedrill is a little puzzled 
> > > since the other bot didn't quite fit in with the Tripreds.
> > > 
> > > ooC: I'd only like to post with Firedill for a limited time, so 
> I'm 
> > > going to be looking for some way to get rid of him. Doesn't have 
> to 
> > > happen right away, but sometime in the futur it will. =)
> > > 
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > Melchana enters the Ship.
> > > > 
> > > > Melchana: Prophecy, shields up.
> > > > 
> > > > The computer acknowledges the command. The Tripredacus lady 
> walks 
> > > to 
> > > > the west side of the ship.
> > > > 
> > > > Melchana: The ship, Firedrill, is divided in three parts. The 
> west 
> > > > side contains the cargo part, the right is where the renewal 
> > > chamber 
> > > > is. The tower contains the Matrix Chamber and the command 
> room. 
> > > For 
> > > > now, we're going to the cargo bay where Belthassan is likely 
> to 
> > be.
> > > > 
> > > > She enters the bay. Tankor is there with Belthassan, 
> inventoring 
> > > the 
> > > > energon fruits. They were huge fruits holding a massive bright 
> > > > blue charge of energon.
> > > > 
> > > > Belthassan: Ah! Sister! How good to see you! And you as well, 
> > > > Firedrill!
